Posts.Content: Yes metastatic breast cancer for a long time now
Posts.Title: Starting to become very thin

Posts.Content: A family member has been battling metastatic breast cancer for a long time and just recently it got really bad after coming back from surgery to remove fluid in her stomach. She is very, very thin right now so I'm trying to feed her as much as I can but she 1) won't eat and 2) pukes when she does. What can I do??
Posts.Title: Starting to become very thin

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by lisa1962 Sorry to hear of your family members difficulties. I have merged your two threads as keeping things all together helps our members to respond better if the details are in one thread. My suggestion, reach out to her doctor and inform them of these events but keep in mind, it is her choice on what she is willing to do. Thank you. I'm just 17 so I'm not sure if I have the authority to call her doctors.. do you think I could?

Posts.Title: Starting to become very thin

Posts.Content: So a member in my family (47 F) came back from surgery (Getting fluid out of her stomach) and hasn't been the same since. She is super skinny, her stomach however is huge, and she is always dazed, sleeping constantly, not eating and not exercising. I want to feed her lots of homemade healthy vegetable and fruit juice and help her exercise but I have two problems that I hope someone can help me about: 1) Is it okay to feed her lots of juice (she won't touch hard foods) even though she has excess fluid in her stomach? 2) I'm afraid if I take her outside in the winter she will pass out or something, what can I do to help her exercise and gain some muscle? Please, please help, thank you
Posts.Title: Starting to become very thin

Please, please help, thank you
Posts.Title: Starting to become very thin

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by lisa1962 Probably not. Those conversations are left up to either the patient or the family member who has medical authority to speak on their behalf. I thought so.. that's why I'm trying to as much as I can but it's just so hard to know what to do. Right now the best thing I can do is feed her as much as I can because she is looking like she's going into the anorexic phase, but she has a swollen belly because of fluids and she also pukes, do you still think it's a good idea to try and fill her up with calories?
